medical_history.chief_complaint: Desire to become pregnant while HIV-positive.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Three months prior to evaluation, the patient and her husband decided they wanted to have a child. She felt well, with no recent symptoms such as fevers, chills, cough, or abdominal pain. They used condoms regularly but had two unplanned pregnancies in the past four months, which were electively terminated.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection diagnosed nine years earlier, asymptomatic, and stable CD4 T-cell count and low viral loads without treatment. History of cervical dysplasia, including mild dysplasia and HPV infection.
medical_history.family_history: The patientâ€™s mother died of cervical cancer at 46 years of age.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with HIV-negative boyfriend and eight-year-old daughter. Occasional cigarette smoker, no illicit drug use or alcohol consumption.
